intro: Iresine pacifica, commonly known as the red leaf iron plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its striking, velvety red or purple foliage, which contrasts with its small, inconspicuous white or pink flowers. The plant belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-drained soil. Iresine pacifica is typically grown as a houseplant or in shaded garden areas due to its sensitivity to direct sunlight.
